org.sopra.api

Interface Scenario


  • public interface Scenario
    A scenario is the data type the game is played on. Each scenario contains a playfield, which represents a model of the land consisting of element typs like grassland, rivers, mountains, seas and beaches. Energy nodes are placed on this playfield. An Energy node is either a producer (all kinds of power plants) or a consumer (e.g. cities or industrial parks, anything that consumes energy). These nodes are connected by edges (PowerLines that transport energy from producer to consumer). Edges and nodes form a graph. The scenario also features functionality to gain information on the current status of the graph and the environment and a command factory that allows to create commands that regulate controllable energy nodes.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      BuildingConfig getBuildingConfig()
      Returns the framework configuration for building abilities.
      CommandFactory getCommandFactory()
      Returns the command factory for this scenario.

      Returns the framework configuration for energy nodes.
      Graph<EnergyNode,PowerLine> getGraph()
      Returns the graph of the scenario.
      java.util.List<PlantLocation> getPlantLocations()
      Returns a list of all plant locations with energy nodes in this scenario.
      Playfield getPlayfield()
      Returns the playfield of this scenario.
      PowerLineConfig getPowerLineConfig()
      Returns the framework configuration for power lines.
      Statistics getStatistics()
      Returns the scenario's statistics.
